comment: Dr. Ford's class is engaging, interactive, and interesting. She is an amazing professor and receptive to multiple perspectives. You get out of this class what you put into it. If you complete all of the readings and engage in the class mtgs, you will find this class challenging. If you don't read or turn on your Teams camera, you will find it easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Took online and the class was very easy, however she was very disorganized the whole semester. No grades the whole semester until the very end where I'm pretty sure everyone just got an A. Very political class. Not a bad teacher at all, but was disorganized and hard to reach out of class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Ford was the easiest teacher I have ever had. I would log into zoom, and that was it. We had a few assignments, but she checked more for completion. She also gave feedback on our assignments as well. She did not answer her emails or texts though.

I took her online class. She took two weeks after semester started to put the syllabus up and does not give clear dates and instructions. She rarely answers emails when questions about the syllabus and instructions come up. This is an easy but very disorganized online class. Very bad at communicating
I loved her. She's one of the best professors I've had in the Educ department. Passionate and kind.
Dr. Ford is a wonderful professor I would take her for every class if I could she is honestly the best professor I have taken at Kennesaw.

Professor Ford was very engaging, but a little too focused on social injustice issues within society and failed to actually teach us anything. It seemed like even though she saw multiple points of view on certain subjects, she acted like hers were the only correct views. There were quizzes every week on the long articles and reading material.

Dr. Ford is a beautiful person inside and out. Before the class began, I had no idea how we would be able to learn all aspects included in the course title: Social Justice and Service Learning through Autoethnography. Dr. Ford somehow made all of that gel, through working on the KSU farm!  Most importantly, I learned so much about myself. AWESOME.

I'm not sure what happened between teaching my class and the ones with great reviews but Dr. Ford was awful. Never responds to emails. Uses class as a soapbox for social justice issues instead of teaching. I honestly don't feel like I've learned ANYTHING in this class. Confusing directions for the few assignments we have. Doesn't explain anything.
Dr. Ford is inspiring in her teaching. She has valuable insights that contribute to learning. She is open to differing views when presented appropriately. Great professor!
she challenged us and listened to us.

Great professor. She gets on your level, she is extremely helpful, and she helps you to understand everything. Second chances for many things are given, and she's very flexible and reinforces you and pushes you to do well. Overall, a great professor. TAKE HER.
